byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Rebecca White and Alan Blinder from Baltimore, Richard Pérez-Peña from New York, and Matt Apuzzo from Washington.

abstract: Maryland law gives special legal protection to police officers suspected of abusing their power; under so-called police officers' bill of rights, officers have 10 days before they have to talk to investigators; complaints against them must be made within 90 days from incident, even if victim is in hospital or is otherwise incapacitated.
lead_paragraph: Commonly known as the police officers’ bill of rights, among its provisions is giving officers 10 days before they have to talk to investigators.

headline.main: Complaints in Baltimore About Law Offering Protections for Officers
headline.print_headline: Complaints in Baltimore About a Law Providing Protections for Officers
